title: Documentation for how pytorch tensor.view() rearranges dimensions?
body_html:
I can't seem to find any documentation about the tensor.view() function or how it is implemented. I am trying to verify that pytorch view will always consistently reshape dimensions. Specifically I am trying to apply the softmax function onto a 4D tensor. I want to be able to verify that

'''
tensor = tensor.view(-1,N)
tensor = nn.Softmax()(tensor)
tensor = tensor.view(-1,N,spatial_dim_1,spatial_dim_2)
'''

will preserve the spatial orientation of the tensor's cells.

Thanks!

EDIT: Verified it myself. I'd still appreciate pointers on how view works if anyone has time.

I can't seem to find any documentation about the tensor.view() function or how it is implemented. I am trying to verify that pytorch view will always consistently reshape dimensions. Specifically I am trying to apply the softmax function onto a 4D tensor. I want to be able to verify that

'''
